property.name: purpose
property.value: In order to determine what needs to be improved about our transportation system, we first need to know what the problems are. Therefore, the first task is brainstorming concerns.

property.name: instruction
property.value: For this task, we are asking you to add concerns to your profile. These concerns will be visible to other participants, and will be used in later sessions to determine how to turn our concerns into suggestions for decision makers. Below, you’ll find a box in which to type your concern. You will be asked to ‘tag’ your concerns, so that others may find your concern more easily. The sidebar to the right of your concerns is your way of seeing what others are writing about. You may navigate by either tags or concerns.

pgame.name: pgame-sarp.drt.bct
pgame.title: 1b: Assess Keyphrases
pgame.description: <small>Review and comment on progress with group keyphrases</small>

props.property:
Instruction overview

Explore other participant's keywords and keyphrases. Make comments and discuss concerns. Vote on moving forward to Step 2 when satisfied.

Detailed instructions   |   Video tutorial
  1. Explore the groups' concerns and keyphrases using the sort and filter tools provided.
  2. Read others' comments and submit your own to discuss the breadth and depth of the group's concerns and keyphrases.
  3. Return to "Step 1a Brainstorm Keyphrases" to edit and/or add concerns and keyphrases as you wish.
  4. Most importantly, "vote to move forward" when satisfied with the groups' results.

property.name: purpose
property.value: In order to determine what needs to be improved about our transportation system, we first need to know what the problems are. Therefore, the first task is brainstorming concerns.

property.name: instruction
property.value: For this task, we are asking you to add concerns to your profile. These concerns will be visible to other participants, and will be used in later sessions to determine how to turn our concerns into suggestions for decision makers. Below, you’ll find a box in which to type your concern. You will be asked to ‘tag’ your concerns, so that others may find your concern more easily. The sidebar to the right of your concerns is your way of seeing what others are writing about. You may navigate by either tags or concerns.

pgame.name: pgame-sarp.drt.cst
pgame.title: 2b. Assess Indicator Labels
pgame.description: <small>Review and comment on progress with indicator labels</small>

props.property:
Instruction overview

Explore other participant's indicator labels for keywords and keyphrases. Make comments and discuss about how they specify a climate condition or something being affected. Vote on moving forward to Step 3 when satisfied.

Detailed instructions   |   Video tutorial
  1. Explore the set of indicator labels and make comments as you wish.
  2. Read others' comments and submit your own to discuss the breadth and depth of the labels.
  3. If the moderator provides announcements, vote your agreement or disagreement.
  4. Vote to move forward when satisfied with the groups' progress.

property.name: purpose
property.value: In order to determine what needs to be improved about our transportation system, we first need to know what the problems are. Therefore, the first task is brainstorming concerns.

property.name: instruction
property.value: For this task, we are asking you to add concerns to your profile. Below, you’ll find a box in which to type your concern. You will be asked to ‘tag’ your concerns, so that others may find your concern more easily. pgame.name: pgame-sarp.cht
pgame.title: 3a. Endorse Labels and Build Index(es) as Needed
pgame.description: <small>Individuals select labels and build index(es) as needed</small>

pgame.name: pgame-sarp.drt.cht
pgame.title: 3b. Assess Indicator Labels and Index(es)
pgame.description: <small>Review and comment on progress with indicator labels and index(es)</small>

props.property:
Instruction overview

This sub-step presents the list of all indicator and index suggestions for group discussion and agreement. A running vote suggests when to move the process forward.

Explore other's indicator labels, make comments about how they are both specific and measurable, then vote on moving forward to Step 4.

Detailed instructions   |   Video tutorial
  1. Explore the indicator list. Users can sort them based on how many users suggested each (frequency), number of votes, or alphabetically. Vote on each indicator to suggest it move forward, counts are updated when users refresh the page.
  2. Read others' comments and submit your own to discuss the breadth and depth of the group indicators.
  3. If the moderator provides announcements, vote your agreement or disagreement.
  4. In the upper right corner of page, vote to move the process forward to Step 4 when satisfied with the groups' progress.

property.name: purpose
property.value: In order to determine what needs to be improved about our transportation system, we first need to know what the problems are. Therefore, the first task is brainstorming concerns.

property.name: instruction
property.value: For this task, we are asking you to add concerns to your profile. These concerns will be visible to other participants, and will be used in later sessions to determine how to turn our concerns into suggestions for decision makers. pgame.name: pgame-sarp.drt.vtt
pgame.title: 4b: Assess Indicators
pgame.description: <small>Review and comment on progress with group indicators</small>

props.property:
Instruction overview

This sub-step enables assessment of the indicators (labels and units) contributed by all users. The first assessment is performed by data specialists. A second assessment is performed by participants.

Explore other participant's fully qualified indicators, make comments about how units of measurement have been assigned to them, then vote on moving forward to Step 4.

Detailed instructions   |   Video tutorial
  1. Click on each indicator path in the left column. Examine the indicator labels and units of measurement. Make a recommendation. Click "Save" after each recommendation you make.
  2. Read others' comments and submit your own to discuss the indicators. The ratio (A/B) in the 'selection' column displays the groups' yes votes (A) for the given indicator in relation to all votes (B).
  3. If the moderator provides announcements, vote your agreement or disagreement.
  4. Vote to move forward when satisfied with the group's progress.

pgame.name: pgame-sarp.vtt.experttool
pgame.title: Data analyst tool
pgame.description: <small>Data analysts review units of measurement for indicators</small>

pgame.name: pgame-sarp.drt.report
pgame.title: 5a Finalize group report
pgame.description: <small>Review and comment on the group report</small>

props.property:
Instruction overview

This step provides a summary of the activity that occurred in Steps 1-4, and enables discussion and consensus building. There is only one sub-step in this activity. When the group reaches agreement over the report, the Voicing Climate Concerns experiment comes to an end, and data analyst will then start a data search.

Detailed instructions
  1. Read the report.
  2. Comment on the report using the form at the bottom of the web page. Comments can be of any character, the more constructive the better.
  3. Vote (at the top right of the page) whether you agree or disagree to move forward and end the process.
